English:
It is not difficult for a person as fascinating as Leonardo to generate an excellent biography but this book by Walter Isaacson is great. He used Leonardo‚Äôs notebooks as the primary source and master guide. The way the book was written, interleaving Leonardo‚Äôs notes and examples of the use of his techniques made the book very pleasant to read. Leonardo‚Äôs curiosity was unbounded and it is impossible to separate the Leonardo the scientist from Leonardo the artist. His notebooks show that art and science are totally intertwined in his work. Another reason that made me like the book was the fact that Isaacson was not a hagiographic biographer. He showed that Leonardo was human and similar to us. Who has never procrastinated? Who has never given up on a boring task? Who has never had ideas that simply never came to fruition? The book is richly illustrated and we were able to read the text and at the same time observe Leonardo‚Äôs work and see how his technique was applied. This book is highly recommended.
